Description.Name: Executive Floor Service Description
Description.Text: Dress codes and age limits apply.

Description.Name: Hotel Alert
Description.Text: All rates are quoted inclusive of VAT

Description.Name: Business/Group Highlight 1
Description.Text: Our London meeting rooms are perfect for inspirational seminars, conferences and presentations.

Description.Name: Business/Group Highlight 2
Description.Text: All meeting rooms are in the historic part of the hotel and benefit from natural daylight.

Description.Name: Business/Group Highlight 3
Description.Text: Some meeting rooms have the additional benefit of interconnecting rooms for breakout sessions.

Description.Name: Business/Group Highlight 4
Description.Text: Hansom Hall is the largest venue able to host meetings of up to 325 theatre style.

Description.Name: Business/Group Highlight 5
Description.Text: The Ladies' Smoking Room is the perfect pre function space with its own outdoor terrace.

Description.Name: Business/Group Highlight 6
Description.Text: Our dedicated events team will work with you to meet the AV needs of your meeting.

Description.Name: Property Social Event Meeting Highlight 1
Description.Text: St Pancras Renaissance Hotel is a stunning London wedding venue, full of Victorian grandeur.

Description.Name: Property Social Event Meeting Highlight 2
Description.Text: The historic Hansom Hall on the ground floor can seat 280 for your wedding reception.

Description.Name: Property Social Event Meeting Highlight 3
Description.Text: Both Hansom Hall & The Ladies’ Smoking room have their own outdoor terraces.

Description.Name: Property Social Event Meeting Highlight 4
Description.Text: The hotel’s grand staircase provides a stunning backdrop for your wedding photographs.

Description.Name: Property Social Event Meeting Highlight 5
Description.Text: We offer exclusive wedding packages or you can work create your own bespoke experience.

Description.Name: Description
Description.Text: After years of devoted restoration, the St Pancras Renaissance London Hotel is being hailed as the city's most romantic building. This 5 star hotel is located at St Pancras International Station and has direct access to London, the UK and Europe.

Description.Name: Property Description Long
Description.Text: After years of restoration, the luxury St. Pancras Renaissance London Hotel has become an icon and model of hospitality. Behind the fairytale façade that Sir George Gilbert Scott fashioned for the Midland Grand is a London 5-star hotel like no other – one that mingles Victorian splendor with contemporary style and service. Step inside the spectacular glazed entrance hall where Victorian high society once alighted from horse-drawn cabs, and stride down the famous grand staircase to dinner in The Gilbert Scott Bar and Restaurant where the brilliant, fresh brasserie cuisine of Marcus Wareing awaits. Our luxury lifestyle hotel in London boasts 245 guest rooms, including 38 beautifully restored and updated suites. While away from your room, take a journey of the senses in St. Pancras Spa offering a sumptuous, subterranean retreat. Imagine the drama of times past while enjoying a refreshment in The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant, our London King's Cross hotel's former ticket hall adjoining St. Pancras station.

Description.Name: Sales Message
Description.Text: This 5 star hotel is located at St Pancras International Station and has direct access to London, the UK and Europe.

Description.Name: Top Selling Feature 1
Description.Text: London’s finest suites are in the original Chambers building with Butler Service, Chambers Club access and VIP transfer service for the Eurostar.

Description.Name: Top Selling Feature 2
Description.Text: This five star London hotel features dining by Marcus Wareing, The Gilbert Scott is an elegant brasserie and bar, run by Marcus Wareing's team.

Description.Name: Top Selling Feature 3
Description.Text: Spa with treatment rooms and a Victorian tiled relaxation pool, offer a sanctuary of tranquility in the heart of this London boutique hotel.

Description.Name: Local Area Highlight 1
Description.Text: Our hotel is adjoined to St. Pancras railway station with access to the Eurostar terminal.

Description.Name: Local Area Highlight 2
Description.Text: Find travel routes to London while visiting our hotel near The Westfield Shopping Centre.

Description.Name: Local Area Highlight 3
Description.Text: English history enthusiasts can find ideal accommodations at our hotel near The British Museum.

Description.Name: Guest Room Highlights 1
Description.Text: The hotel’s Barlow bedrooms are spacious and contemporary, located in newest part of the building.

Description.Name: Guest Room Highlights 2
Description.Text: The luxury suites of this 5 star hotel feature contemporary design fused with period features.

Description.Name: Guest Room Highlights 3
Description.Text: Guests of the suites benefit from butler service, VIP transfers on the Eurostar and free WiFi.

Description.Name: Guest Room Highlights 4
Description.Text: Suite guests also have access to the Chambers Club serving complimentary snacks and drinks.

Description.Name: Guest Room Highlights 5
Description.Text: All rooms have high-speed Internet access (for a fee), flat-screen TVs and in-room safes.

Description.Name: Guest Room Highlights 6
Description.Text: The well-equipped rooms of this hotel offer the perfect haven after a day’s sightseeing in London.

Description.Name: Guest Room Highlights
Description.ListItem: The hotel’s Barlow bedrooms are spacious and contemporary, located in newest part of the building.
The luxury suites of this 5 star hotel feature contemporary design fused with period features.
Guests of the suites benefit from butler service, VIP transfers on the Eurostar and free WiFi.
Suite guests also have access to the Chambers Club serving complimentary snacks and drinks.
All rooms have high-speed Internet access (for a fee), flat-screen TVs and in-room safes.
The well-equipped rooms of this hotel offer the perfect haven after a day’s sightseeing in London.

OwnershipManagementInfo.CompanyName: Manhattan Loft St. Pancras Hotel Limited

RestaurantDescription.Name: Restaurant Short Description
RestaurantDescription.Text: A striking setting for a business breakfast, or classic English dining from an all day menu, The Booking Office Bar also features an array of punches and cocktails recreated from lost recipes from the London Victorian era.

RestaurantDescription.Name: Restaurant Short Description
RestaurantDescription.Text: An extension to The Booking Office Bar, The Platform Cafe offers al fresco dining overlooking the Eurostar platforms.

Restaurant.RestaurantName: The Gilbert Scott Bar and Restaurant

RestaurantDescription.Name: Restaurant Short Description
RestaurantDescription.Text: Operated by Marcus Wareing, one of Britain's most celebrated chefs, The Gilbert Scott is a distinctive bar and restaurant experience offering a menu featuring an enticing array of London classics.

RestaurantDescription.Name: Restaurant Short Description
RestaurantDescription.Text: Enjoy a range of hot & cold drinks, traditional afternoon tea and light snacks, the old taxi rank to St. Pancras station now forms London's most spectacular hotel lobby restaurant and meeting space.

RestaurantDescription.Name: Restaurant Short Description
RestaurantDescription.Text: The St Pancras Grand Restaurant, Oyster and Champagne Bar is located on the Upper Concourse alongside the Eurostar platform of St Pancras International.

RestaurantDescription.Name: Restaurant Short Description
RestaurantDescription.Text: Camino has been created as a place to enjoy the life, vigour and tastes of Spain.

RestaurantDescription.Name: Restaurant Short Description
RestaurantDescription.Text: The Rotunda ethos isn't complicated - great food and a great atmosphere. A canal-side location means we provide the perfect environment in which to relax and enjoy over a hearty meal and a healthy dose of one of many wines.

RestaurantDescription.Name: Restaurant Short Description
RestaurantDescription.Text: The dining room, with its soft lighting, banquette seating & glass-walled kitchen, fulfils Atherton’s ambition of matching the flexibility of the food with an informal atmosphere

RestaurantDescription.Name: Restaurant Short Description
RestaurantDescription.Text: Situated between High Holborn and Red Lion Square, The Bountiful Cow is a public house dedicated to serving the finest steaks and burgers at affordable prices

RestaurantDescription.Name: Restaurant Short Description
RestaurantDescription.Text: Rules was established by Thomas Rule in 1798 making it the oldest restaurant in London. It serves traditional British food

Description.Name: Pet Policy Description
Description.Text: Pets up to 10 kg/22 pounds allowed with non-refundable fee of GBP 30 per stay

Description.Name: Is Written Authorization Required for Credit Card Deposits
Brief Property Location Description
Description.Text: This 5* hotel at St Pancras station has fantastic transport links across London, the UK and Europe.

Attraction.AttractionName: Central St Martins College of Art and Design

Description.Name: Driving Instructions from Airport
Description.Text: From London Heathrow International Airport join the A30 for Central London. After approximately 4km take the A4 to Central London and Hammersmith. After approximately 8km, join the North Circular (A406) to Wembley & Ealing. At Gunnersbury Park, turn right onto the A4000 to Shepherds Bush, Acton. Follow the A4000 to Harlesden, Park Royal until reaching Gypsy Corner, signed A40, Central London. Join the A40 and continue forward to the A501 passing Madam Tussauds and Regents Park Underground Station. Continue forward on the A501 joining the Ring Road towards The City and Kings Cross. Arrive on Euston Road and welcome to welcome to the hotel. .

Transportation.Description: Drive Time to Airport in Rush Hour
Bus from Airport to Hotel Fee (one-way)
Subway from Airport to Hotel Fee (one-way)
Rail from Airport to Hotel Fee (one-way)

Description.Name: Driving Instructions from Airport
Description.Text: From London Gatwick International airport, follow signs to the M23 signposted London M23. Once on the M23, after approximately 10 miles merge onto the A23 signposted London. Continue forward on the A23 following signs for Central London, Brixton. After approximately 15 miles on the A23 follow signposts for Central London, Westminster and Waterloo. Bear right onto the A302 and bear right shortly after this signed Waterloo Bridge, London Bridge A3200. At the roundabout take the second exit onto the A301 signposted Waterloo Bridge. Follow the A301 until it meets the A4200. When on the A4200, turn left at Holborn Underground Station signed Bank, Angel, Shoreditch. Continue on to the A501 signposted Kings Cross and St Pancras International Station. Arrive on Euston Road and welcome to welcome to the hotel.

Transportation.Description: Drive Time to Airport in Rush Hour
Bus from Airport to Hotel Fee (one-way)
Subway from Airport to Hotel Fee (one-way)
Rail from Airport to Hotel Fee (one-way)

Description.Name: Driving Instructions from Airport
Description.Text: At Stansted International Airport, join the A120 signposted Way Out, M11. Join the M11 South signposted London. Continue straight for just over 20 miles and then branch left onto the A406 signposted North Circular, A406 (S), A12, A13. Join the A12 Signposted Central London, Blackwall Tunnel & Stratford. At Lea Interchange, branch left and merge onto the A106 Signposted Hackney, New Spittalfields Market. Turn left onto the B112 and then continue straight on the A102. At the traffic lights, turn left onto the A107 Signposted Dalston. Continue forward on the A104 following signs to Dalston, Highbury. Turn left onto the A1 until it is possible to join the A501 Signposted West End. Continue forward on the A501 following signs for Ring Road (W), Kings Cross and St Pancras International Station. Turn onto Euston Road and welcome to welcome to the hotel.

Transportation.Description: Drive Time to Airport in Rush Hour
Bus from Airport to Hotel Fee (one-way)
Subway from Airport to Hotel Fee (one-way)
Rail from Airport to Hotel Fee (one-way)

Description.Name: Driving Instructions from Airport
Description.Text: Join the A1011 Signed Blackwall Tunnel. At the roundabout, join the A1020 Signposted North Circular Road, Dartford Tunnel, Excel East. After 0.5 of a mile, Join the A112 signposted Stratford until you can join the A13 signposted Central London, Blackwall Tunnel. After approximately 2 miles, keep in the left hand lane signposted Central London, Canary Wharf. Continuing forward on the A13 towards Central London, Whitechapel and Tower Bridge join the A1202 Ring Road North towards the West End. Continue forward on the A10 signposted Ring Road. Join the A5202 until you can join the A501 signposted West End, Islington. Once on the A501 continue forward towards West End and Kings Cross. After approximately 1 mile, continue to follow signs towards Kings Cross and St Pancras International Station. Continue forward onto Midland Road. Turn onto Euston Road and welcome to the hotel.

Transportation.Description: Drive Time to Airport in Rush Hour
Bus from Airport to Hotel Fee (one-way)
Subway from Airport to Hotel Fee (one-way)
Rail from Airport to Hotel Fee (one-way)

Description.Name: Driving Instructions from Airport
Description.Text: Leave the airport and follow the signs for M1 South towards London. At junction 2, exit toward C. London (The City)/Holloway/N Circular/A406 East/A1. Merge onto Great North Way (Barnet Bypass). Continue onto Great N Way/A1, after 0.8 miles continue onto N Circular Rd/A406. After 3.5 miles, take a slight right at Falloden Way/A1. After 1.5 miles, continue on to Junction Rd/A400. Take a slight left at Royal College St/A5202, then take a slight left to stay on A5202. Turn left at Pancras Rd/A5202 and then turn left onto Euston Road. The hotel will be on the left hand side.

Transportation.Description: Drive Time to Airport in Rush Hour
Bus from Airport to Hotel Fee (one-way)
Subway from Airport to Hotel Fee (one-way)
Rail from Airport to Hotel Fee (one-way)

Description.Text: With so much to see and do, a visit to ZSL London Zoo is the perfect day out for people of all ages

Description.Text: Britain's original home for abandoned children and London's first ever public art gallery.

Spa marketing description
Description.Text: Accompany us on a journey of the senses from St. Pancras to Africa, India & the Far East. Discover the finest beauty recipes & remedies at this London spa, then indulge in your own tranquil transport of delight. Click 'Learn More' to view the Spa Website.

Description.Name: Directions from Highway to Property
Description.Text: Leave the hotel and turn right, at the second set of lights turn right and follow signs towards M1.

TPA_Ext_MessageType.Title: Royal Manuscripts: The Genius of Illumination’

Description.Name: Message Text
Description.Text: This is a new exhibition at The British Library. Discover medieval and Renaissance illuminated manuscripts, collected by the kings and queens of England over 800 years. guests can receive £2 off per person upon presentation of their key card at the Library ticket desk.

Description.Name: Message Text
Description.Text: The Booking Office's cathedral-like drama, 29m-long bar and fresh English fare are conversation-stoppers at any time of day. The Booking Office Bar is open until 3am daily.

Description.Name: Message Text
Description.Text: The Victorian era was the age of great romantic heroines, whose fortunes in love caused a stir in the hotel’s early years. Set the start of your romantic adventure in surroundings that would have graced the endings. The St. Pancras Renaissance London Hotel is licesenced to conduct civil cermonies.

Description.Name: Message Text
Description.Text: Valet car parking is avaliable at the hotel, spaces on the hotel forecourt will be used on a first come, first served basis, alternative off-site car parking can be used. For prices & further information, please call the hotel on +44 (0) 20 7841 3540.

Description.Name: Message Text
Description.Text: Historical tours of the hotel are now available. They last around 1 hour and cover all parts of this magical building.Tours run as required and cost £20.00. To book, please call 0207 841 3569

Description.Name: Message Text
Description.Text: If you want more information about holding an event at the hotel please email us at stpancrasevents@marriott.com

Description.Name: Message Text
Description.Text: Guests staying in the historical Chambers Rooms & Suites can now begin or end their journey in style with a Eurostar VIP transfer service, dedicated Butlers and Concierge are on hand to guide you straight to or from your Eurostar carriage and fast track you through security & avoid any queuing.

Description.Name: Message Text
Description.Text: Guests staying in the historical Chambers Rooms & Suites can now begin or end their journey in style with a Eurostar VIP transfer service, dedicated Butlers and Concierge are on hand to guide you straight to or from your Eurostar carriage and fast track you through security & avoid any queuing.

Description.Name: Message Text
Description.Text: Heat and water experiences in St Pancras Spa and the changing rooms will be closed due to essential maintenance works from the 23rd March to the 27th March. Alternate changing facilities will be provided. We apologise for any inconvenience caused.

Description.Text: Treat her to a traditional Afternoon Tea or lunch in the Booking Office
